text: I can't believe it! Finally, my first dataset made in Julia is ready for its intended purpose :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you to everyone here that has made that possible. Without your help, I may have given up. The Julia community is the best! Special thanks to <@UBF9YRB6H> <@U7JQGPGCQ>

elements.text: I can't believe it! Finally, my first dataset made in Julia is ready for its intended purpose
Thank you to everyone here that has made that possible. Without your help, I may have given up. The Julia community is the best! Special thanks to

text: Glad to hear! As Peter said in one of the threads I think if you want to stick with it the best next step is to develop a strong foundation in basic Julia (how do arrays work, iterators, broadcasting, anonymous functions, etc) - imho the biggest strength of the Julia data ecosystem and DataFrames in particular is that there are very few special functions to learn, everything composes nicely from a small but powerful set of building blocks

elements.text: Glad to hear! As Peter said in one of the threads I think if you want to stick with it the best next step is to develop a strong foundation in basic Julia (how do arrays work, iterators, broadcasting, anonymous functions, etc) - imho the biggest strength of the Julia data ecosystem and DataFrames in particular is that there are very few special functions to learn, everything composes nicely from a small but powerful set of building blocks

text: <@U7JQGPGCQ> Thank you. I'm going to put in the time and effort to develop a strong foundation. It's so great to hear this perspective about Julia. Hearing this motivates me a lot.
